course.subject: FINA
course.name: Corporate Valuation
course.description: This course teaches students how to use financial information to value firms. By the end of this course, students will be able to value firms using discounted cash flow valuation, relative valuation, and real options.

reviews.author: Jasa
reviews.title: What a Joke
reviews.comment_teaching:
If you truly want to learn about valuation, you should watch Damodaran's videos on youtube and his website. This is the most time-efficient and effective way to learn.

For Goyal, he tried to use case studies to lengthen the course schedule. On one hand it helps you understand concepts, on another, outdated and biased (according to Damodaran).
reviews.comment_grading: Most of your classmates are from WBB, QFIN, FINA (superior ones), so its so competitive. In Chinese, too 卷 :)
reviews.comment_workload:
SHIT. Like a 6 credit course. There is something to do every week. Those kept disturbing my job seeking during the period.

5 Group Case Study, 1 Presentation.
1 Group Valuation Project, with 5 interim submissions.
Active Participation.

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
The first half of the semester covers quantitative techniques in valuing a firm, like discounted cash flows, weighted average cost of capital (WACC), relative valuation etc. . You will have to apply those techniques to complete an individual project, which is to perform valuation for a firm of your choice and provide stock market trading recommendations.
For the second half some applications of valuation in the financial market will be covered, like IPO, venture capital, leveraged buyouts (LBOs) and acquisitions. One case study for each application (4 in total) to support the professor's teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Maybe this is the first time he teaches corporate valuation classes (?) he was teaching 3303 in previous semesters. From time to time he might be unclear what he should say in class, but he did show passion in teaching. Rather than asking you to think in his way and memorize hard facts in valuation, he provided a lot of inspirations for you to 'tell your own story' (he always used this phrase lol). In other words, he was guiding you to generate your personal insights in valuation. Therefore, don't expect much concrete knowledge you can learn from him - you will be learning from your own research under his guidelines.

However, he provided a lot of instructions and examples for us to construct the required spreadsheets in valuation project and arranged Thomson Reuters + Bloomberg training sections. Maybe these skills are more useful in your career than his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
At the beginning of the semester the grading scheme was like this:
15% Midterm Exam
25% Individual Project
50% Final Exam
10% Class Participation

The professor changed the scheme midway through the semester. Midterm exam was cancelled and case studies were introduced. The grading then became:
10% Case Studies
35% Individual Project
50% Final Exam
5% Class Participation (Don't know how he counts though)

For case studies, you just need to hand in 2 simple write-ups out of 4 case studies and each counts for 5%.

Final Exam is a valuation exercise similar to the project with MUCH MORE qualitative questions to the mock exam. For those questions he is always asking for your opinion about certain kind of financial transactions instead of memorization of facts, like asking you whether the firm is a good target for LBO etc. Make sure you don't ignore these content after revising quantitative parts.

I believe I did my project quite well but poorly for case studies. I should also have f*cked up in final exam since I almost skipped all applications of valuation, leaving those qualitative questions blank. Still ended up with a B-. The professor claimed that average grade is between B and B+, and it seems to be true. Grading is very generous - this is a finance course after all, will you expect a good grade at the beginning? :)

One minor thing: all scores in each grading element were not disclosed. If your grade is not as good as expected you won't know what went wrong.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload comes from project.

25% of the score comes from your own work. This includes a complete set of spreadsheets from financial statements to free cash flows, from capital structure to WACC, and from peer firms selection to relative valuation (using their accounting ratios), as well as a 10-pages report of 'the story' of your chosen firm. Although he required us to hand in interim work, like different parts of the excel file, you still have to amend your insights and your work after he covers new topics. Spending a few nights to complete the whole stuff is necessary.

10% of the grade comes from evaluating your peer's work. This part is much simpler - generate 3-pages PPT slides about what you like and dislike of his or her work, and discuss with the peer and the professor in his office. Frankly speaking, I don't know how he grades this part - he keeps scrolling through his iPad on one's valuation project while we are speaking and referring to the slides. Maybe you can only get a good score here if you provide extraordinary insights and attract him to listen to you.

For case studies, some (the first 2 if I remember correctly) are shorter (up to 10 pages including appendix) and with much fewer write-up questions, while others are so long with exceptionally challenging questions. Do earlier posted case studies if there are no time conflicts, otherwise it could be a torture as you go through a 30-pages thing.

reviews.author: Fina真係好辛·苦．
reviews.title: 重workload
reviews.comment_content: 頭幾堂都係講番2303,3103同3303教過嘅野,例如FCF, WACC, cost of equity，跟住幾堂就guide住我地做project,點樣make assumptions,中後期就講IPO, leveraged buyout個類.Prof 會自己做左間firm 嘅valuation教，算易理解。成個course幾pratical，透過唔同data去估值一間firm
reviews.comment_teaching: 堂堂飲汽水同行暈成個班房係佢嘅特色，有時想訓佢行過黎就即刻嚇寫。佢教每個topic都會有case同 examples 去講，幾易明，唔明佢都會好樂意堂上即刻答。不過有少少催眠，好多時頭半堂都頂唔順訓左後半堂先認真聽
reviews.comment_grading:
Final: 50%
Project:25%
Project discussion: 10%
Cases(best 2): 10%
Participation: 5%
Final會同mock類似係做一間firm嘅valuation，有cheatsheet，大部分sub式+少量concept題
Project: firm valuation，prof會喺頭幾堂每星期要我地交份唔計分嘅HW, guide住我地揀firm, make assumption，只要做晒hw, project唔會大炒
Cases: 4份,每份5%, take best 2,驚做得唔好就做多過2份，過左 submission deadline就會上堂講答案，好大出入就做埋後面幾份
Participation:除左第一堂會計低英文名，跟住就冇take attendance, 唔知點計
Professor 話個course 嘅mean 係B至B+，同埋佢用盡晒dept比A  range同 B range 嘅quota，相對付出左嘅努力，我覺得都幾爛。Prof比分好鬆，所以差幾分就會影響幾個sub grade.
From his email, 99% got 70% overall or above, 90% got 80% overall or above. 我86%，最後B左。My fd 91% A-，project都改得算鬆，最緊要final
reviews.comment_workload:
超多。
Add drop之後嘅第一堂就要交你間firm 嘅 selection。交完selection之後每個禮拜都要交homework，例如揀peer firms做multiple valuation、計WACC等等，每個星期都keep住chur。
諗住做晒D HW，跟住有長時間去慢慢做project，結果係每星期要交一份case report(case大概10頁)，寫2頁write-up。當然如果有信心頭2份拎滿分可以唔洗做後2分，不過分唔出最後淆底都係做晒。
完晒case都11月，跟住有2星期比我地做final project.做完11月尾要4人一組上prof office 做discussion,呢個相對輕鬆，係睇你組員份report，簡介間公司，佢有咩寫得好有咩寫得唔好，可以拎稿。
Prof 一開始為左減輕我地workload 刪左midterm變做cases, 結果好似仲辛苦左。感覺成個sem都係做緊呢個course嘅assignments無得抖。
